bill_title: require an attendant to a home birth to provide certain disclosures to the woman giving birth.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require an attendant to a home birth to provide certain disclosures to the woman giving birth. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 36-2 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any person not licensed pursuant to chapters 36-2 to 36-11, inclusive, other than a family member, who attends a home birth shall provide to the woman giving birth, a written disclosure signed by the attendant, and acknowledged by the woman giving birth, that includes: (1) A declaration whether or not the attendant is a certified nurse midwife, a registered nurse, or a physician; (2) The number of home births attended during the previous five years; (3) The education, training, and experience of the attendant; (4) A description of the natural birth process and pre-natal and postpartum care routinely given by the attendant in connection with a home birth; (5) A declaration as to what specific medications may be prescribed by the attendant, if any; (6) A description of the risks and benefits of home birth, including the nature and probability of risk of death or bodily injury; (7) A description of the alternatives and their risks and benefits, including references to hospitals, unattended births, and birth centers; and (8) A description of the available transportation alternatives in the event the woman giving birth requires transportation to a medical facility.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
